text: The 1905 international cricket season was from April 1905 to August 1905. The season consists with the famous British Authors vs British Actors cricket match in England. ==Season overview== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="7" |International tours |- ! rowspan="2" |Start date ! rowspan="2" |Home team ! rowspan="2" |Away team ! colspan="4" |Results [Matches] |- !Test !ODI !FC !LA |- | | | |2–0 [5] |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text- align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |- | |Authors |Actors |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text- align:center"| — |0–1 [1] |- | | Philadelphia |Marylebone |; style="text- align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |1–1 [2] |; style="text- align:center"| — |} ==May== === Australia in England === {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="9"|The Ashes Test series |- ! No. ! Date ! Home captain ! Away captain ! Venue ! Result |- | Test 83 || 29–31 May || Stanley Jackson || Joe Darling || Trent Bridge, Nottingham || by 213 runs |- | Test 84 || 15–17 June || Stanley Jackson || Joe Darling || Lord's, London || Match drawn |- | Test 85 || 3–5 July || Stanley Jackson || Joe Darling || Headingley Cricket Ground, Leeds || Match drawn |- | Test 86 || 24–26 July || Stanley Jackson || Joe Darling || Old Trafford Cricket Ground, Manchester || {cr|ENG}} by an innings and 80 runs |- | Test 87 || 14–16 August || Stanley Jackson || Joe Darling || Kennington Oval, London || Match drawn |} ==June== === Actors vs Authors in England === {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="9"|One-day match |- ! No. ! Date ! Home captain ! Away captain ! Venue ! Result |- | Match || 29 June || Arthur Conan Doyle || Aubrey Smith || Lord's, London || Actors by 7 wickets |} ==July== === MCC in USA === {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="9"|First-class Series |- ! No. ! Date ! Home captain ! Away captain ! Venue ! Result |- | Match 1 || 22–25 July || John Lester || Eric Mann || Germantown Cricket Club Ground, Manheim || Marylebone by 7 wickets |- | Match 2 || 22–25 July || John Lester || Eric Mann || Merion Cricket Club Ground, Philadelphia || Gentlemen of Philadelphia by 61 runs |} ==References== Category:International cricket competitions by season Category:1905 in cricket
title: International cricket in 1905
